Package game.movegeneration.pieces

Interface PieceI

All Known Implementing Classes:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public interface PieceI
The PieceI interface represents a chess piece and provides methods for interacting with it.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryu

  • Method Details

    • getPieceType

      int getPieceType()
      Returns a unique identifier for each piece type. 0 for empty, 1 for pawn, 2 for knight, 3 for bishop, 4 for rook, 5 for queen, 6 for king
      Returns:
      The piece type identifier.

    • getPieceColour

      int getPieceColour()
      Returns the color of the piece (e.g., 0 for white, 1 for black).
      Returns:
      The piece color.

    • isWhite

      default boolean isWhite()
      returns true when the selected piece is white.
      Returns:
      true if white.

    • generateMove

      long generateMove(int from, boolean isWhite, GameState previousGameState)
      Generates legal moves for the piece from the given position.
      Parameters:
      from - The starting position of the piece.
      isWhite - Whether the piece is white.
      previousGameState - The previous game state for move generation.
      Returns:
      A bitboard representing possible moves.

    • toggleBB

      void toggleBB(int from, boolean isWhite)
      Toggles the bitboard for the given square based on the piece color.
      Parameters:
      from - The square to toggle.
      isWhite - Whether the piece is white.

    • isValidMove

      default boolean isValidMove(int from, int to, GameState previousGameState)
      Checks if a move from one square to another is valid for the piece.
      Parameters:
      from - The starting square.
      to - The target square.
      previousGameState - The previous game state for move validation.
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • addPiece

      static PieceI addPiece(int pos, int pieceType, int pieceColour)
      Adds a piece to the square-centric board and bitboards based on the provided values.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to add the piece.
      pieceType - The type of the piece.
      pieceColour - The color of the piece.
      Returns:
      The newly created chess piece.

    • printMask

      default void printMask(long bits)
      Debugging Prints the bitboard mask for debugging purposes.
      Parameters:
      bits - The bitboard mask to print.
